maml:description.maml:para: Installs required assemblies.

command:description.maml:para: Install-Module cmdlet enables the user to deploy provider assemblies to the deployment folder in NCache installed directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly to be imported.
Specifies the name of the cache for assemblyӳ deployment.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command deploys the assembly for demoCache.
This command deploys the assembly for demoCache on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a Backing source to the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Add-Backingsource cmdlet enables users to configure read-through and write-through providers for the specified cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly which will be configured as a backing source.
Specifies the name of the cache for which backing source will be configured.
Specifies the fully qualified class from the backing source assembly which implements ReadThru/WriteThru.
Specifies the list of the parameters passed to the backing source provider ('$'separated) e.g. key1=value1'$'key2=value2'$'....
Specifies if provided backing source is configured for ReadThru.
Specifies if provided backing source is configured for WriteThru.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running and a cache with the specified cache-name is registered. The default is the local machine.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the provider name.
Specifies if no assembly should be deployed.
Specifies the dependent assembly folder/path.
Specifies that whether you want to enable batching or not.
Specifies the time that cache suspends each operation write on data source
Specifies periodic interval for operation expiration.
Specifies the rate at which cache writes the updates to database.
Specifies maximum operation count to be re-queued in case of data source write operation failure.
Specifies failed operations eviction ratio.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures read-through provider for the demoCache.
This command configures write-through provider for the demoCache.
This command configures write-through provider with batching enabled, for the demoCache that exists on server 20.200.21.11.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-BackingSource -CacheName demoCache -AssemblyPath C:\Provider.dll -class WriteThrough.Writer -ProviderName MyWriter -WriteThru -Server 20.200.21.11 -isBatching -OperationDelay 10 -BatchInterval 5 -OperationPerSecond 500 -OperationQueueLimit 5000 -OperationEvictionRatio 5 -Parameters _connectionString=Server=localhost; Database=Northwind; Trusted_Connection=True;'$' LoggerInfo=Server=localhost;Database=TestLogger;Trusted_Connection=True;

dev:remarks.maml:para: The following command configures write-through provider with batching enabled, operation-delay 10ms, batchinterval 5s, operations-per-second 500, operation-queue-limit 5000, operation-evictions-ratio 5%, parameter-list _connectionString=ԠServer=localhost;Database=Northwind;Trusted_Connection=True;Ԡand LoggerInfo=ԠServer=localhost;Database=TestLogger;Trusted_Connection=True;Ԡfor the demoCache that exists on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes backing source.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-Backingsource cmdlet enables users to remove the already configured read-through and write-through providers for the cache specified.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which backing source will be removed.
Specifies if provided backing source is configured for ReadThru.
Specifies if provided backing source is configured for WriteThru.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the provider name.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the pre-configured read-through provider for the demoCache.
This command removes the pre-configured write-through provider for the demoCache.
This command removes the pre-configured write-through provider for the demoCache exist on the server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the bridge.

command:description.maml:para: Start-Bridge cmdlet enables users to start a bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies one or more name(s) of bridges registered on the server. The bridge(s) with this/these name(s) is/are started on the server.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

maml:introduction.maml:paragraph: The following command starts bridge on local server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts cache named demoCache on local server.
This command starts bridge demoBridge existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates new bridge.

command:description.maml:para: New-Bridge cmdlet enables user to create a new bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the port on which bridge listens.
Specifies the active node of the bridge.
Specifies the passive node of the bridge.
Specifies the upper limit for size of queue in MB.
Specifies each replicator queue size.
Specifies time interval in seconds between two consecutive replication operation on target cache.
Specifies time interval in seconds between consecutive connection retries to target cache if not connected.
Specifies the Bridge ID.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies if queue is optimized. Default value is false.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new bridge and configures it on active node 20.200.21.11.
This command creates a new bridge and configures it on active node 20.200.21.11 and passive node 20.200.21.12.
This command creates a new bridge that listens on port 10001 and configures it on active node 20.200.21.11 and passive node 20.200.21.12.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds bridge cache.

command:description.maml:para: Add-BridgeCache cmdlet enables the user to add cache to bridge specified.

maml:description.maml:para: Possible values: Active, Passive
Server IP of the bridge where Bridge is hosted.
Server name/Ip Address where cache is located.
Possible values: Active, Passive
Alias of the Cache to add in Bridge Server. Alias Should be unique for two Caches in one bridge
CacheName or CachName is the name of clustered cache that is to be added in bridge.
Specifies the Bridge ID to be used.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Add cache named demoCache on Bridge named demoBridge both local server.
This command Add cache named demoCache on CacheServer 20.200.21.11 to Bridge named demoBridge on BridgeServer 20.200.21.12.
This command Add cache named demoCache on CacheServer 20.200.21.11 to Bridge named demoBridge on BridgeServer 20.200.21.12.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes Bridge Cache.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-BridgeCache cmdlet enables the user to remove the cache registered on specified bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Server IP/Name of the bridge where Bridge is hosted.
Alias of the Cache to add in Bridge Server. Alias Should be unique for two Caches in one bridge
Server name/Ip Address where cache is located.
CacheName or CachName is the name of clustered cache that is to be added in bridge.
Specifies the Bridge ID to be used.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes cache named demoCache on Bridge named demoBridge both local server.
This command Remove cache named demoCache on CacheServer 20.200.21.11 to Bridge named demoBridge on BridgeServer 20.200.21.12.
This command Remove cache named demoCache on CacheServer 20.200.21.11 to Bridge named demoBridge on BridgeServer 20.200.21.12.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets bridge cache connection.

command:description.maml:para: Set-BridgeCacheConnection cmdlet sets bridge cache connection status Active or Passive for the bridge

maml:description.maml:para: Possible values: Connect, Disconnect
Server IP of the bridge where Bridge is hosted.
Server name/Ip Address where cache is located.
Possible values: Connect, Disconnect
CacheName or CachName is the name of clustered cache that is to be added in bridge.
Specifies the Bridge ID to be used.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Set cache Connection named demoCache on Bridge named demoBridge both on local server.

This command Set cache Connection status to Connect for cache named demoCache with Alias demoAlias to Bridge named demoBridge

maml:description.maml:para: Sets bridge cache mode.

command:description.maml:para: Set-BridgeCacheMode cmdlet sets the Cahe Mode for bridge cache from Active to Passive or Passive to Active.

maml:description.maml:para: Possible values: Active, Passive
Server IP of the bridge where Bridge is hosted.
Server name/Ip Address where cache is located.
Possible values: Active, Passive
CacheName or CachName is the name of clustered cache that is to be added in bridge.
Specifies the Bridge ID to be used.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Set cache State to Active named demoCache on Bridge named demoBridge both on local server.
This command Set cache state Passive on Cache named demoCache on CacheServer 20.200.21.11 to Bridge named demoBridge on BridgeServer 20.200.21.12.
This command Set cache State status to Active for cache named demoCache with Alias demoAlias to Bridge named demoBridge

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the bridge.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-Bridge cmdlet enables user to remove a bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the server on which bridge is registered. Default is local server.
Specifies the Bridge ID.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes demoBridge registered on local server.
This command removes bridge demoBridge on server 20.200.21.12.
This command removes bridge demoBridge on server 20.200.21.12.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds bridge node.

command:description.maml:para: Add-BridgeNode cmdlet enables the user to add a bridge node. Max two nodes can be added to a bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the bridge server.
Specifies the new node to be added in bridge.
Specifies the BridgeID.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.

Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds server 20.200.21.11 to demoBridge nodes.
This command adds server 20.200.21.11 to demoBridge running on server 20.200.21.12.
This command adds server 20.200.21.11 to demoBridge running on server 20.200.21.12 and suppresses the logo.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes bridge node.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-BridgeNode cmdlet removes the specified node from bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the server where bridge service is running.
Specifies the bridge node that has to be deleted.
Specifies the BridgeID.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.

This command deletes node 20.200.21.12 from demoBridge on server 20.200.21.11 with suppressing the logo.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops the bridge.

command:description.maml:para: Stop-Bridge cmdlet enables users to stop a bridge.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies one or more name(s) of bridges registered on the server. The bridge(s) with this/these name(s) is/are stopped on the server.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies a server name where the NBridge service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops bridge named demoBridge on local server.
This command stops bridge named demoBridge existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Clears the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Clear-Cache cmdlet enables the user to clear the cache by removing all the items present in the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Name of the cache for which you want to use this tool.
Force the clearing of the cache. If not specified, the user is asked before clearing the cache.
Clear JavaScript and CSS only.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command clears the demoCache.
This command forcefully clears the cache and does not ask the user before clearing the cache.
This command clears JavaScript or CSS content from the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new cache.

command:description.maml:para: New-Cache cmdlet enables the user to create a new cache on one or more server nodes.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which cache will be registered.
Specifies the isolation level for local cache.
Specifies the NCache server names/IPs where Cache should be configured, separated by commas e.g. 20.200.21.11,20.200.21.12
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the size (MB) of the cache to be created. Default value is 1024 MB for local cache.
Specifies the eviction policy for cache items. Cached items will be cleaned from the cache according to the specified policy if the cache reaches its limit. Possible values are
i. Priority
ii. LFU
iii. LRU (default)
Specifies the eviction ratio (Percentage) for cache items. Cached items will be cleaned from the cache according to the specified ratio if the cache reaches its limit. Default value is 5 (percent)
Specifies the time interval (seconds) after which cache cleanup is called. Default clean-interval is 15 (seconds)
For topology other than local you have to give topology and cluster port. Specifies the topology in case of clustered cache. Possible values are
I. Local
II. Mirrored
III. Replicated
IV. Partitioned
V. Partitioned-Replica
Only in case of 'partitioned-replica-server' being the topology, this specifies the replication strategy
i. Async (default)
ii. Sync
Specifies the port of the server, at which server listens.
Specifies the default priority in case of priority based eviction policy is selected. Possible values are
i. high
ii. above-normal
iii. normal (default)
iv. below-normal
v. low
Specifies the path of the cache source config which will be configured.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates new cache named demoCache on server 20.200.21.11 having size 1024 MB and topology local for simple case.
This command creates a local cache named demoCache of size 1024 MB on server 20.200.21.11, with the configuration that exists on the specified path.
This command creates new cache named demoCache on server 20.200.21.11 having size 1024 MB and topology replicated and occupying the port 8701 for simple case.

This command creates new cache named demoCache on server 20.200.21.11 having size 1024 MB, topology partitioned, eviction policy priority, default priority high, eviction ratio 10%, clean interval 20, occupying cluster port 8701.
This command creates new cache named demoCache on servers 20.200.21.11 and 20.200.21.12 having size 1024 MB and topology replicated and occupying the port 8701 for simple case.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-Cache cmdlet enables the user to remove an already registered cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies name of cache that has to be removed. Cache must exist on source server.

Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running and a cache with the specified cache-name is registered. Cache configuration is copied from this server to the destination server. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the demoCache from local server.
This command removes the demoCache from server 20.200.21.11.
This command uses port also and removes the demoCache from server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Start-Cache cmdlet starts the registered cache. If nodes are mentioned, the cache process is only started on given nodes.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies one or more name(s) of caches separated by comma registered on the server. The cache(s) with this/these name(s) is/are started on the server. Note: Comma-separated cache names are to be specified in case of multiple caches
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

maml:introduction.maml:paragraph: The following command starts cache on local server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts cache named demoCache on local server.
This command starts cache named demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.
This command uses port and starts cache named demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops the registered cache.

command:description.maml:para: Stop-Cache cmdlet enables users to stop a cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies one or more name(s) of caches separated by comma registered on the server. The cache(s) with this/these name(s) is/are stopped on the server. Note: Comma-separated cache names are to be specified in case of multiple caches
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine.
Specifies if the cache be stopped gracefully.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops demoCache on local server.
This command stops demoCache on sever 20.200.21.11
This command stops cache demoCache gracefully existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the configuration of cache.

command:description.maml:para: Export-CacheConfiguration cmdlet enables the user to get the configuration for the specified cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path where config will be generated.
Specifies the name of the cache for which cache configuration will be generated.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command generates the configuration file for the demoCache.
This command generates the configuration file for the demoCache on specified path
This command uses port also to generate the configuration file for the demoCache on specified path

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the cache count.

command:description.maml:para: Get-CacheCount cmdlet enables the user to get the total count of items present in the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Name of the cache for which you want to use this tool.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays total numbers of items currently in cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Dumps the cache data.

command:description.maml:para: Export-CacheData cmdlet enables the user to get a backup of all the items currently present in the cache to a network or local path.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies id of cache to be backed up or restored.
Specifies backup/restore path.
Specifies path where dependent assemblies reside.
Specifies file size limit of the data file generated during backup. Default: 5 MB.
Specifies the number of errors that can be tolerated during backup or restore. Default: 1.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command backs up all the keys currently present in the cache.
This command backs up all the keys currently present in the cache to data file sizes of maximum 2 MB.

maml:description.maml:para: Reloads the cache data.

command:description.maml:para: Import-CacheData cmdlet enables the user to reload all the items from a backup in the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies id of cache to be backed up or restored.
Specifies backup/restore path.
Specifies path where dependent assemblies reside.
Specifies bulk insertion size during restore. Default: 1000.
Specifies the number of errors that can be tolerated during backup or restore. Default: 1.
Specifies the expiration policy with which the data is restored to cache. Default: Adjusted. [Options:] None, Adjusted, Asbefore.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command reloads all the items to the cache from the path specified.
This command reloads all the items to the cache from the path specified and will exit if 10 errors occur during the process.
This command reloads all the items in bulk of 100 to the cache from the path specified.
This command reloads all the items to the cache from the path specified without absolute expiration (if applicable).

maml:description.maml:para: Dumps keys in cache.

command:description.maml:para: Export-CacheKeys cmdlet enables the user to dump keys to the console currently present in the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies id of cache to be dumped.
Specifies the number of keys. The default value is 1000.
Specifies the keys that contain this substring. By default it is empty.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command dumps the 1000 keys currently present in the cache
This command dumps the 500 keys currently present in the cache.
This command dumps the 500 keys currently present in the cache containing 11 as substring in keys.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists the registered caches.

command:description.maml:para: Get-Caches cmdlet enables the user to list the total caches registered on the server and there status.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Displays detailed information about the cache(s) registered on the server.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays all caches registered on local machine.
This command displays all caches currently registered on the provided server with detailed information.
This command displays all caches currently registered on the server with detailed information.

maml:description.maml:para: Configures cache security.

command:description.maml:para: Add-CacheSecurity cmdlet enables the user to configure cache level security for the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which you want to use this tool.
Specifies the user name to add.
Specifies the existing user which is now being deleted or removed from NCache node administrators
Specifies that the tool is being used for enabling security on a specific node.
Specifies that the tool is being used for removing a user from Cache administrator's list.
Specifies that the tool is being used for disabling security on a specific node.
Specifies that the tool is being used for adding a user in Cache administrator's list.
Specifies the server node name.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the domain controller.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds new users to cache administrator's list.
This command deletes a user from cache administrator's list.
This command enables security for the cache.
This command disables security for the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates client cache.

command:description.maml:para: New-ClientCache cmdlet enables the user to create a new client cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the clustered cache name. A clustered cache must be specified for creating a client cache.
Specifies the path of the cache source config which will be configured.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip where Cluster Cache is registered.
Specifies the name or Id of Client Cache.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the cache size (MB) allocated to the client cache. Default value is 1024 MB
Specifies the eviction policy for cache items. Cached items will be cleaned from the cache according to the specified policy if the cache reaches its limit. Possible values are
i. Priority
ii. LFU
iii. LRU (default)
Specifies the eviction ratio (Percentage) for cache items. Cached items will becleaned from the cache according to the specified ratio if the cache reaches its limitDefault value is 5 (percent).
Specifies the default priority in case of priority based eviction policy is selected.
Possible values are
i. high
ii. above-normal
iii. normal (default)
iv. below-normal
v. low
Specifies if optimistic Client Cache Synchronization Mode should be enabled.
Specifies a client node which is registered with the Cluster Cache.
Specifies the time interval (seconds) after which cache cleanup is called. Default clean-interval is 15 (seconds)
Specifies whether to update the client-nodes sections of server node(s) of the specified cluster. The default value is true. Useful when cluster nodes and clients are in different networks.
Specifies whether the client cache is inProc or outProc. Default value is outProc
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates new client cache named demoClientCache on client node 20.200.21.12 for an already registered clustered cache on server 20.200.21.11 having size 1024 MB for simple case.
This command creates new client cache named demoClientCache on client node 20.200.21.12 for an already registered clustered cache on server 20.200.21.11 for advance case.

This command creates new client cache named demoClientCache on client node 20.200.21.12 for an already registered clustered cache on server 20.200.21.11 having size 1024 MB and optimistic Client Cache synchronization Mode for simple case

maml:description.maml:para: Removes client cache.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-ClientCache cmdlet enables the user remove client cache from client node.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the node on which you want to remove client cache.
Specifies the clustered cache name. A clustered cache must be specified for each client cache.

Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running and a cache with the specified cache-name is registered. Cache configuration is copied from this server to the destination server. The default is the local machine.
Specifies the name or Id of Client Cache to remove.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes client cache named demoClientCache from client node 20.200.21.11.
This command removes client cache named demoClientCache on client node 20.200.21.12 for an already registered clustered cache on server 20.200.21.11.
This command removes used port to remove client cache named demoClientCache on client node 20.200.21.12 for an already registered clustered cache on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds client node.

command:description.maml:para: Add-ClientNode cmdlet enable users to add client nodes to the existing clustered cache(s).

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the clustered cache. Cache must exist on source server.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running and a cache with the specified cache-name is registered.
Specifies a client node (node to be added as client node) where the NCache service is running.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies whether to update the client-nodes sections of server node(s) of the specified cluster. The default value is true.(Useful when cluster nodes and clients are in different networks)
Specifies whether to fetch the server mapping list from the server node(s). The default value is false. (Useful when cluster nodes and clients are in different networks).
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a client node 20.200.21.12 to the demoCache which exists on server 20.200.20.11.
This command adds a client node 20.200.21.12 to the demoCache which exists on server 20.200.20.11 while specifying port-number.
This command adds a client node 20.200.21.12 to the demoCache which exists on server 20.200.20.11 while specifying port-number and not updating server config.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes client node.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-ClientNode cmdlet enables users to remove client nodes from the existing clustered caches.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies id of Clustered Cache. Cache must exist on source server.

Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running and a cache with the specified cache-name is registered. Cache configuration is copied from this server to the destination server. The default is the local machine
Specifies a client node where the NCache service is running.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes client node 20.200.21.12 from the demoCache.
This command removes a client node 20.200.21.12 from the demoCache which exists on server 20.200.20.11.
This command uses port also and removes a client node 20.200.21.12 from the demoCache which exists on server 20.200.20.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds security on node level.

command:description.maml:para: Add-ClientNodeSecurity cmdlet enables the user to configure node level security to perform administrative or management tasks.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which you want to use this tool.
Specifies the target node.
Specifies the administrator Id. To configure security on any node, administrative rights are required.
Specifies the administrator password.
Specifies the domain controller.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the primary user Id.
Specifies the secondary user Id.
Specifies the password for primary user.
Specifies the password for secondary user.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds new user david_watson to node (20.200.21.11) administrator's list for demoCache, and writes the security credentials for the user to NCacheService.exe.config.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds compact type to the registered cache..

command:description.maml:para: Add-CompactType cmdlet enable users to register a custom object for compact serialization for the given caches.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly which will be configured as a compact type.
Specifies the name of the cache for which compact type will be configured.
Specifies the class for compact serialization.
Specifies the non-compact attribute for compact serialization with a delimiter '$'.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures a compact serializable object for the cache.
This command configures a compact serializable object for the cache with some non-compact attributes
This command configures a compact serializable object for the cache with some non-compact attributes on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes compact type.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-CompactType cmdlet enable users to remove already defined compact serializable objects.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which compact type will be removed.
Specifies the class for removing from compact serialization.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the compact serializable class from cache configuration.
This command removes the compact serializable class from cache configuration on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds test data.

command:description.maml:para: Add-TestData cmdlet adds test data to the specified cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which you want to use this tool.
Number of items to be added to the cache. By default 10 items are added to the cache
Size in bytes of each item to be added to the cache. By default items of 1k (1024 bytes) are added to the cache.
Specify in seconds, absolute expiration (default: 300; minimum: 15)
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds 10 items to the demoCache with expiry of 5 minutes.
This command adds 100 items to the demoCache with expiry of 5 minutes.
This command 100 items of size 2KB to the demoCache with expiry of 5 minutes.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds portable classes.

command:description.maml:para: Add-PortableType cmdlet enables users to register different custom classes and data types for data sharing.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which data share will be configured.
Specifies the path of the cache source config which will be configured.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures shared types object for the cache.
This command configures shared types object for the cache existing on server 20.200.21.11
This command configures shared types object for the cache existing on server 20.200.21.11 and port.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes portable classes.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-PortableType cmdlet enables users to remove already defined shared types.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which data share will be removed.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes defined shared types for demoCache.
This command removes defined shared types for demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Verifies license.

command:description.maml:para: Get-NCacheVersion cmdlet enables the user to verify the NCache License. For registered version it will display the registration details. In evaluation mode it will display the remaining day if evaluation is still valid else give the expiration message.

maml:description.maml:para: Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays registration details.
This command displays registration details without displaying logo banner.

maml:description.maml:para: Configures map reduce.

command:description.maml:para: Add-MapReduce cmdlet enables the user to configure MapReduce tasks for processing and generating large data sets with a parallel, distributed algorithm on a cluster through NCache

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the id/name of cache for which MapReduce will be configured.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the maximum number of tasks to be executed in parallel.
Specifies the number of elements a chunk should contain before it is transmitted to combiner or reducer.
Specifies the maximum number of tasks that can be queued if the server is busy.
Specifies maximum avoidable exceptions while executing the task.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses the startup banner and copyright message.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures MapReduce execution on demoCache with default options.
This command will configure MapReduce on demoCache with 10 tasks to be executed in parallel with chunks of 100 elements each, 30 tasks to be enqueued and maximum 10 exceptions to be avoided.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes monitoring.

command:description.maml:para: Invoke-MonitorServer cmdlet enables the user to start and stop monitoring the activities performed on the server and log these activities in a log file.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the action i.e start or stop.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts the monitoring server.
This command stops the monitoring server.
This command starts monitoring the server on node 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds server node to cache cluster.

command:description.maml:para: Add-Node cmdlet enables users to add a new server node to the existing clustered cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies name of Clustered Cache .Cache must exist on source server.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running and a cache with the specified cache-name is registered. Cache configuration is copied from this server to the destination server.
Specifies a server name where a cache with the specified cache-name needs to be registered. The cache configuration is copied from the source server name to this server.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds a new node 20.200.21.12 to the cache existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes server node.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-Node cmdlet enables users to remove node from existing cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies id of cache registered on the server. The cache with this id is unregistered on the server.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. This server will be removed from specified cache. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies for graceful Stop.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Supresses the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes local node from the demoCache.
This command removes node 20.200.21.12 from the demoCache.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds security.

command:description.maml:para: Add-NodeSecurity cmdlet enables the user to configure node level security for the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the user name to add.
Specifies new user password.
Specifies the existing user which is now being deleted or removed from NCache node administrators.
Specifies the client node where security is to be configured.
Specifies the administrator Id. To configure security on any node, administrative rights are required.
Specifies the administrator password.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the domain controller.
Specifies that the tool is being used for enabling security on a specific node.
Specifies that the tool is being used for removing a user from NCache node administrators.
This user name can also be an administrator, because to disable security you can either be an NCache node administrator or you have the administrator rights on the target node.
Specifies that the tool is being used for adding a user in Cache administrator's list.
Specifies whether to write to service configurations.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures node level security on node 20.200.20.11 whose admin user is david_watson.
This command removes node level security on node 20.200.20.11 whose admin user is david_watson.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds query index.

command:description.maml:para: Add-QueryIndex cmdlet enable users to add query indexes for the objects to be added in the cache so that later on user can search items in the cache using these indexes..

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly which will be configured.
Specifies the name of the cache for which query index will be configured.
Specifies the name of the cache for which query index will be configured.
Specifies the attributes for query indexing ('$' separated) e.g. CustomerID'$'Name ...
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds query index for the attribute CustomerID in cache.
This command adds query index for the attribute CustomerID in cache on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes query index.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-QueryIndex cmdlet enables users to remove pre-defined query indexes for the objects to be added in the cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which query index will be configured.
Specifies the name of the cache for which query index will be configured.
Specifies the attributes for query indexing ('$' separated) e.g. CustomerID'$'Name ...
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes query indexes for customer class.
This command removes query indexes for customer class on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes server logging.

command:description.maml:para: Invoke-ServerLogger cmdlet is used to enable detailed logging for both socket-server and all the clients.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables error and detailed logging.
Disables error and detailed logging.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables socket-server logs.
This command disables socket-server logs

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies from where to load data on cache start.

command:description.maml:para: Add-StartupLoader cmdlet enables users to configure start up loader provider for the cache which will load the items from datasource to the cache when cache will start.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the path of the assembly which will be configured as a startup loader.
Specifies the name of the cache for which cache loader will be configured.
Specifies the fully qualified class from the startup loader which implements ICacheLoader/ICache Startup Provider.
Specifies the list of the parameters passed to the cache loader e.g. key1=value1'$'key2=value2....
Specifies the hints list.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies number of retries for loading data in cache.
Specifies the retry interval for loading data in cache.
Specify if no assembly should be deployed.
Specifies the dependent assembly folder/path.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures startup-loader for the demoCache.
This command configures startup-loader for the demoCache on server 20.200.21.12.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes loader.

command:description.maml:para: Remove-StartupLoader cmdlet enable users to remove a pre-configured start up loader provider of the given cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which cache loader will be configured.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes startup-loader for the demoCache.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts stress test tool.

command:description.maml:para: Test-Stress cmdlet enables users to quickly simulate heavy transactional load on a given cache. And, this helps you see how NCache actually performs under stress in your own environment. Please watch NCache performance counters in NCache Manager "statistics" or regular PerfMon.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies name of the cache.
Specifies how many total items you want to add. (default: infinite)
Specifies how many iterations within a test case (default: 20)
Specifies how much delay (in seconds) between each test case iteration (default: 0)
Specifies how many gets within one iteration of a test case (default: 1)
Specifies how many updates within one iteration of a test case (default: 1)
Specifies in bytes the size of each cache item (default: 1024)
Specifies in seconds sliding expiration (default: 300; minimum: 15)
Specifies how many client threads (default: 1; maximum: 3)
Report after this many total iterations (default: 5000)
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorisation if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command executes stresstesttool on demoCache.
This command executes stresstesttool on demoCache and will add items of size 2kb

maml:description.maml:para: Gets topics registered on cache.

command:description.maml:para: Get-Topics cmdlet lists all topics registered on specified cache. It displays the topic names, messages, subscribers and publishers.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the cache name for which topics have to be listed.
Specifies a server name where the NCache service is running. The default is the local machine
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets topics registered on demoCache.
This command gets topics registered on demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.
This command uses port and gets topics registered on demoCache existing on server 20.200.21.11.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables Lucene index.

command:description.maml:para: Enable-LuceneIndex cmdlet can be used to enable Lucene index and specify the Lucene index path.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which Lucene index will be configured.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.

By default, index directories are generated at [InstallDir]\lucene. If you want these indexes to be generated at a different location, please use this parameter to specify a valid path. Please make sure that this path exists on all cache server(s) and no other index writer is locking the directory.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorization if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables Lucene index for demoCache.
This command enables Lucene index and sets the index path to "C:\LuceneIndex"
This command enables Lucene index on demoCache on server 20.200.21.11

maml:description.maml:para: Disables Lucene index.

command:description.maml:para: Disable-LuceneIndex cmdlet can be used to disable Lucene index.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the cache for which Lucene index will be configured.
Specifies the NCache server name/ip.
Specifies the port on which NCache server is listening. Default port is 8250.
Specifies the UserId that is used to authorize the user if security is enabled on the cache server. This UserId must be same as the active directory user credentials.
Specifies the password for user authorization if security is enabled on cache server. This password must be the same as active directory password.
Suppresses display of the logo banner.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables Lucene index for demoCache.
This command disables Lucene index for demoCache on server 20.200.21.11
